meanings.definition: To bring into agreement or accord.
meanings.sent1: The group harmonises their ideas before starting the project.
meanings.sent2: The team harmonises their schedules to work together efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The siblings harmonise their preferences for the family vacation destination.
meanings.sent4: The colors of the painting harmonise perfectly, creating a beautiful masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The chef harmonises the flavors in the dish to create a delicious meal.

meanings.definition: To combine in a pleasing or orderly way.
meanings.sent1: The interior designer harmonises different patterns in the room decor.
meanings.sent2: The artist harmonises various textures in the sculpture.
meanings.sent3: The garden harmonises colorful flowers with green foliage.
meanings.sent4: The music producer harmonises different instruments to create a unique sound.
meanings.sent5: The chef harmonises diverse ingredients to make a flavorful dish.

meanings.definition: To sing or play in harmony.
meanings.sent1: The choir harmonises beautifully during the performance.
meanings.sent2: The band harmonises their instruments for a melodious song.
meanings.sent3: The birds harmonise their chirping in the early morning.
meanings.sent4: The orchestra harmonises the music, creating a symphonic masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The siblings harmonise their voices while singing together.
